title: Sustainable Forestry and Pest Control FRQ

content.question:
(a) Forests are often considered a commons or a shared resource. They can often experience the tragedy of the commons.
i. Explain the concept of the tragedy of the commons

frqParts.text:
(a) Forests are often considered a commons or a shared resource. They can often experience the tragedy of the commons.
i. Explain the concept of the tragedy of the commons
ii. Describe one potential approach to reducing the occurrence of the tragedy of the commons in forests.
iii. Identify a negative effect of increasing pest populations in forests or agricultural areas.

(b) Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></math> shows the occurrence of several different forest pests in western Montana identified by aerial surveys from 2000 to 2015. Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></math> shows the average temperature in July in Montana from 1950 to 2015.

i. Identify the year when leaf spots were found in the highest percent of the surveyed area.
ii. Describe the trend for the occurrence of caterpillars in forests in western Montana from 2010 to 2013.
iii. Explain what the data in both graphs imply about the relationship between temperature and beetle survival.

(c) Methods to protect forests from pathogens and insects include using integrated pest management (<math alttext="I P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IPM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>).
i. Identify one method of <math alttext="I P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IPM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is used to control pests.

ii. Integrated pest management can be used in sustainable forest management to control pests, rather than removing affected trees. Justify the use of integrated pest management as an alternative to removing affected trees by explaining a potential advantage of <math alttext="I P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IPM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in forests other than pest control.

(d) In addition to affecting forests, pests can affect agricultural areas.
i. Make a claim that proposes a solution other than <math alttext="I P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IPM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to the problem of pests in agriculture.
ii. Describe a possible disadvantage or an unintended consequence of the solution proposed in part (d)(i).

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
